description: From French almicantarat, almucantarat, from Medieval Latin almicantarath, almucantarath, from Arabic المقنطرات‎ (almuqanṭarāt, “circles of celestial latitude”), from قَنْطَرَة‎ (qanṭara, “arch”).

entries.meaning: (astronomy, archaic or historical) A small circle on the celestial sphere, parallel to the horizon, that is used in astronomy and navigation to show altitude of a star or any other heavenly body.
(astronomy, archaic or historical) An instrument for observing the heavenly bodies as they cross such a circle.
